page.title: 10RELIGION
page.content: Orton Church is dedicated to "All Saints" and was originally in the care of the Priory of Conishead. The original church, which stood on the present site, was a Norman structure. The building today has parts which are over 700 years old. The tower was probably built in 1504, the porch was erected in 1607 and the font, made of fine sandstone, is inscribed with the date 1662. Restoration of the chancel was carried out in 1877 and the tower was restored in 1977. The rectory and advowson of the parish of Orton were bought in 1618 by three parishoners for Â£570, in trust for the landowners within the parish. 0rton is one of very few parishes in this country whos Vicar is elected to office by vote. The Methodist Church in the village was built in 1833 by Stephen Brunskill
